experience: You and Matthew both know Keith Rezendes, Micah Mangione, and 28 others
Matthew can introduce you to 6 people at Meggitt

--Developed report with Lead Coach team identifying innovative ways to engage students and increase First Year Success Center retention efforts--Supported First Year Success Center in Event Planning, 2017-2018 New Hire Recruitment through various media platforms-- Regularly managed phone and email outreach to a portfolio of 120+ students, updated google documents, Peoplesoft, and utilized specific comment codes to document student situations on university databases-- Identified students’ personal, financial, and academic goals and established personalized plans of action and goal setting-- Sustained 98% satisfaction rating among students-- Escalated student crisis situations through consulting supervisors in a timely manner to ensure student well being

-- Utlize CPFR tools and Tableau to anaylze historical volume, demand planning forecasts, and annual customer promotions to close gap between expected and actual volume-- Develop communication strategies to ensure alignment between customer requests and warehouse capabilities -- Use SAP to conduct daily past due shipment and item cut report for Publix customer account-- Support CPFR team in capturing retail store data for analysis

-- Supported W.P. Carey coaching team in conducting 1394 coaching appointments - exceeding team goal by 26.7%-- Directly contributed to student development and retention through conducting 280+ personalized appointments and over 140 hours of phone and in-person coaching during the 2015-2016 academic school year.-- Regularly managed phone and email outreach to a portfolio of 180+ students, updated google documents, Peoplesoft, and utilized specific comment codes to document student situations on university databases-- Identified students’ personal, financial, and academic goals and established personalized plans of action and goal setting-- Sustained 98% satisfaction rating among students-- Escalated student crisis situations through consulting supervisors in a timely manner to ensure student well being

-- Working knowledge of SAP -- Submitted $750,000+ in Purchase Orders and RFQs for MRO related items.-- Managed MRO inventory – calculated monthly consumption and applied reorder points to reduce $10,000 of excess inventory -- Reduced $6000 in working capital by consolidating packaging suppliers and switching to vendor managed inventory system-- Negotiated a 16% cost savings in a subcontracted warehousing agreement to improve inbound flow of raw materials-- Negotiated w/ supplier an increase in purchasing volume of desiccant bags; resulting in 14% annual cost savings

-- Executed 1000+ phone calls to students nationwide-- Recorded student responses and satisfaction to support 98% data accountability -- Leverage university-wide assets to connect with students in an interpersonal manner
-- Sustained HR processes through auditing 150+ portfolios of hotel employees-- Maintained 3.7/5 guest satisfaction

-- High quality fine dining, working under pressure to ensure superb customer service-- Learned fast paced communication techniques to enhance team performance during peak hours-- Developed attention-to-detail and organization skills for high volume order processing-- Worked with a team to deliver high volume food orders in a timely manner

-- Lead team of incoming students through various team-building activities and programs to acquaint them with the University and the business school -- Promoted a positive atmosphere among students and other program facilitators-- Implemented conflict resolution strategies in correlation to team building efforts among students-- Achieved the "Best Facilitator Pair" Award with my co-facilitator for having outstanding leadership skills

-- Further advanced public speaking skills through discussing University topics with prospective students and parents-- Developed customer service skills through the utilization of telecommunication techniques-- Worked with a team to establish good relationships throughout the Student Admissions Relations community-- Extensive experience communicating with visitors, providing tours, promoting ASU-- Experience with fast paced, dynamic customer service, creating a positive atmosphere

recommendations: "I had the great pleasure to have Matt Jirak join and enhance the output of our GGB Purchasing Team for his 2015 Summer Internship assignment. I am a Senior Buyer working for a leading Global Bearing Manufacturer. At the end of this assignment, our Purchasing Team, two GGB manufacturing plants, all the suppliers Matt interacted with and GGB personnel are very thankful for the significant contributions Matt afforded us. I was impressed with how comfortably and effectively Matt collaborated with a wide range of GGB colleagues, manufacturing personnel and managers, including Supply Chain Manager, Plant Managers, Marketing Director, Project Manager, approximately 100 in all. . Matt productively accomplished a varied and vast number of Purchasing duties; filing, one daily job PO, communicated a daily SAP On Time Delivery report, co-created a Kanban Plant Process, sourced/visited a new outside Warehouse and much more. I listened to many calls with suppliers and found Matt to conduct each call with great respect and professionalism. No training, coaching or encouragement required. I witnessed Matt’s professionalism, interpersonal skills, negotiation skills, productivity, collaborative skills and so much more. I strongly recommend Matt to any similar role. "

Plant Operations + Leadership Executive/GM | Strategies + Culture Revitalization for Operations in Need of Turnaround

As a three-month intern in a metal stamping manufacturing plant, Matt displayed a level of energy, intelligence, and maturity beyond his years. In a very short period of time, he quickly added value in the supply chain department by reducing MRO costs, conducting a 3PL logistic study with identified savings, and worked with a critical supplier in evaluating a sourcing strategy. Matt worked with ease across all functional departments and at every level of the plant.

Matthew interned at GGB Bearing Technology Summer 2015.  He was very quick to catch on to all tasks/projects that were assigned to him.  His internship covered a wide variety of Supply Chain tasks such as placing purchase orders, setting up Kanbans, setting up Vendor managed stock, reporting on supply chain metrics, and reducing inventory.  Matthew proved to be a valuable asset to our team and we would love to have him back next summer.

March 16, 2015, Matthew worked with Andrew in the same group

I worked with Matthew Jirak over the past couple of years.  I found Matthew is be one of the hardest working individuals I know who consistently demonstrates professionalism, enthusiasm, and initiative to his colleagues.  I was fortunate to work with Matthew on several projects where he analyzed the logistics and financing for an outdoor sporting event including food and a dodge ball tournament in spring 2014.  Matthew effectively budgeted and motivated the people around him to plan for the event.  His leadership was a huge factor to the event's success.Through my role as the Scholastic Chairman within our fraternity, I was pleased to see Matthew's eagerness to learn and consistently adds more value to projects or teams with his positive attitude, work ethic, and creativity.  He is able to take on a challenge and understand how to efficiently solve the problem.  Because of his skills and characteristics, Matthew has become a role model to his community at a young age. Furthermore, Matthew has the ability to bring a smile to my face and inspire me to work hard.  He is not only a great team member, but an outstanding individual with a big heart.It is an absolute pleasure to work with Matthew and know he will be an asset to a company or business.  I recommend him to the full extend and would love to answer any questions about Matthew.  You can contact me at (928) 848-9397 or my email, andrew.hickey@asu.edu.

Event Planner | Campus Visit Manager | Welcome Center Expert | Training Guru | Student Organization Wrangler

It is with great pleasure that I write this letter of recommendation for Matthew Jirak.  I met Matt a few years ago and have seen him as an immense student leader both on and off campus.  Matt was a member of two of the paraprofessional student organizations I advise on the Tempe campus, called Devils’ Advocates and the Student Admissions Relations Team (START).  Devils’ Advocates is one of the oldest organizations on campus and has many engrained traditions, which show the caliber of student that is part of this organization.  Devils’ Advocates serve as tour guides and ambassadors for ASU along with Undergraduate Admissions.  START is one of the organizations on campus that are involved in many recruitment efforts through Undergraduate Admissions.  START students also serve as ambassadors for ASU by working at an information desk, giving presentations on the student prospective, as well as many other special recruitment events.  Matthew has also worked for me directly over school breaks.Matt possesses many attributes of a great leader.  He is a student who is goal-oriented and one who has a friendly demeanor that is able to build wonderful rapport with people of all ages.  His written and verbal communication skills are excellent, and he is extremely organized, reliable and proficient at multi-tasking.  Matthew accomplishes his responsibilities with great initiative and with a very positive attitude.

June 20, 2015, Andrew worked with Matthew in the same group

I have known Andrew Hickey for almost two years and in that time we have grown together as both friends and fraternity brothers. Andrew is a motivated, intelligent, and ambitious young man that consistently works to his fullest extent in an effort to ensure that all aspects of a project are completed in a timely manner. I had the pleasure of working with Andrew in coordinating the logistics behind a dodgeball tournament and barbecue for over seventy five people in the spring of 2014. He quickly assumed a leadership role among our team and profusely engaged his peers with ideas about our event. Andrew consistently demonstrates a strong drive to succeed and an enthusiasm to give back to his university, community, and fraternity. He has been elected as the Academic Standards Chair within our fraternity and it is his responsibility to oversee the academic development of our entire chapter. He works well with the members of our fraternity through his ability to implement flexibility into the scheduling of our study hours and other meetings. He has done an outstanding job in his commitment to creating groups that facilitate and encourage professional development including his sponsorship of our fraternity LinkedIn page. I believe Andrew has an impeccable work ethic and always comes to meetings well prepared to inform his peers about his responsibilities. He never overburdens himself and has set clear priorities. His ability to respond to critical feedback is also highly admirable because he has demonstrated a skill in adaptability to the suggestions and ideas of our fraternity. Andrew Hickey would undoubtedly be an asset to any team in the future and I recommend him enthusiastically and without reservation. Please contact me (610) 883-1444 or mjirak@asu.edu if you have any further questions.
